column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r2432442213\r\r1\r224243244\r\r2\r243244233\r\r3\r245224234\r\r4\r3221343293\r\r5\r3312333333\r\r6\r321228132813\r\rOther**\r81\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement422730\r\rAll training and curriculum development activities at Chaparral Elementary School revolve around the California State Standards and other identified\rneeds. During the 2018-19 school year
column3: Chaparral Elementary School held staff development training devoted to:\r•\rProfessional Learning Communities\r•\rCalifornia State Standards\r•\riPad Training and Technology Integration\r•\rFormative Assessment Techniques\r•\rEnglish Language Arts/English Language Development Framework\r•\rResponse to Intervention and Positive Behavior Interventions and Supports\r•\rCalifornia Assessment of Student Performance Institute\r•\rCalifornia NGSS: Implementing Three-Dimensional Science Learning\r•\rPath to Proficiency\r\rDecisions concerning selection of staff development activities are performed by all staff using tools such as teacher input and data analysis to determine\rthe areas in which additional teacher training may enhance classroom instruction and increase student achievement levels. Chaparral Elementary School\rsupports ongoing professional growth throughout the year on minimum days. Teachers meet in grade level teams to conduct data analysis to identify\rareas of need. Teaching staff are provided the opportunity to participate in district-sponsored staff development workshops or training session as 1) a\rsupplement to site-based staff development
column4: 2) for reinforcement of or follow-up on previous training
column5: or 3) follow-up training for newly implemented\rprograms/curricula.\r\rDuring the 2018-19 school year
